sections.1_story_intuition: Government schemes are special programs launched by the government to address social, economic, and developmental needs. In competitive exams, questions about major schemes, their objectives, launch years, and target groups are common. Knowing these facts helps candidates answer static and current GK questions effectively.
2_key_definitions: Government Scheme: A planned program by the government for public welfare.
Flagship Scheme: Major scheme with high priority.
Beneficiary: Person or group receiving benefits.
Subsidy: Financial support from the government.
Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT): Transfer of subsidies directly to beneficiaries.
Pension: Regular payment to retired persons.
Skill Development: Training to improve employability.
Social Security: Protection against economic risks.
Microfinance: Small loans to low-income groups.
3_key_facts_data_points: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana: Financial inclusion scheme (2014).
Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana: Housing for all (2015).
Swachh Bharat Mission: Clean India campaign (2014).
Ayushman Bharat: Health insurance scheme (2018).
Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana: Free LPG connections (2016).
Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi: Income support to farmers (2019).
Atal Pension Yojana: Pension for unorganized sector (2015).
Make in India: Boost manufacturing (2014).
Digital India: Promote digital access (2015).
Skill India: Skill development program (2015).
Beti Bachao Beti Padhao: Girl child welfare (2015).
Stand Up India: Loans for SC/ST and women (2016).
PM Fasal Bima Yojana: Crop insurance (2016).
National Nutrition Mission: Improve nutrition (2018).
Startup India: Promote entrepreneurship (2016).
Jal Jeevan Mission: Safe drinking water (2019).
Saubhagya Yojana: Electricity for all (2017).
Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana: Loans to small businesses (2015).
Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana: Savings for girl child (2015).
MGNREGA: Rural employment guarantee (2005).

7_traps_confusing_points: Assuming all schemes are for rural areas.
Mixing up health and insurance schemes.
Assuming all schemes are central government.

8_case_study_context.title: Jan Dhan Yojana: Financial Inclusion
8_case_study_context.explanation: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana, launched in 2014, aimed to provide banking access to all households in India. It led to millions of new bank accounts and improved financial inclusion, especially in rural areas.
